column1: Narrator : East of here is the labyrinth of NOMTRESOR, supposedly hiding a big treasure.
column4: Narrator : CAPITAINE are in their childhood bedroom. Next to their bed, the desk is covered with drawings, books and tales about the ocean.

column1: Narrator : Aboard the NOMBATEAU, CAPITAINE sets sail to venture there and grab it for themselves.

column4: Choice : (go back to the living room) (leave)

column6: Narrator : It says that east from here, the furthest from every shore you can be, you can find a huge, maze-like island.
Narrator : The island also supposedly is riddled with caves filled with precious loot.
Narrator : Before venturing into the Labyrinth and the wild waters surrounding it…
Narrator : One would do well to explore and prepare as much as they can in the villages and other islands around…

column1: Narrator : CAPITAINE steps back on the small island where they grew up. A rock path leads to their childhood cottage.
Choice : (go back to the living room) (leave)
Narrator : The garden is peaceful as always. Over the distant sound of the sea, a few seagulls cry out. Sunlight is gently warming CAPITAINE up.
column2: Narrator : The night is quiet and mild. The only sounds breaking the silence are the surrounding hum of crickets, and the hooting of an owl nearby.

column1: Choice : (go back to the living room)(leave)
